overlays.idp_delete_info_intro: Please note, all users which are not migrated to the new iDP wii get irreversible deleted.

overlays.idp_delete_error_intro: Please retry or contact an administrator if the failure persist.

overlays.idp_test_intro2: The IdP is disabled for now and get enabled below.

registration-requests.introText1: The application request board includes all current outstanding application requests as well as an overview of confirmed and declined company applications to the Cofinity-X Network.
registration-requests.introText2: If an application is approved, the registration company will receive access to the CX portal to start the technical and functional onboarding. Please make sure that you validate the application request details before approving a request.

overlay.title: Company Registration Details
overlay.companydatadescription: Below you can find the details of the company registration

confirmmodal.title: Confirm action
confirmmodal.description: Are you sure to make action on selected request?

confirmCancelModal.title: Reject application process
confirmCancelModal.description: Are you sure you want to cancel the application process of {companyName}?
confirmCancelModal.details: With confirming the cancellation, the registration company will get informed and the cancellation message added below will be shared.
confirmCancelModal.note: Please note that the cancellation wont allow the company to register again, as long as no new registration is triggered.

semantichub.title: Semantic
semantichub.introText_0: Semantic models are used to structure data. As a concept, they make it possible to give fundamental meaning to data and their relationships. In the context of data modeling and data organization they realize the development of applications as well as the maintenance of data consistency.
semantichub.introText_1: In Cofinity-X, semantic data models are provided in a suitable publication system, the so-called Semantic Hub. For data or service providers, the Semantic Hub presents a foundation for the use and reuse of semantic models. For this reason, the publication of a semantic data model takes place under the specification of a version. This supports transparency as well as control over all semantic models and their release status.

filter.objNamePlaceholder: Enter a object name to filter

deleteDialog.title: Delete aspect model?
deleteDialog.subtitle: Are you sure you want to delete the aspect model?
deleteDialog.info: Note: If you delete the model now, you won't be able to reactivate it later.

detail.fileError: Error: The file could not be loaded.
detail.ttlTooltip: The downloaded Turtle file looks different but is semantically the same compared to the uploaded Turtle file for the Aspect. To further develop existing Aspects refer to the source Turtle files (e.g. in the Cofinity-X BAMM Model GitHub Repository)
detail.downloadTitle: Download options related to this aspect model

openApi.inputLabel: Enter a base URL to change the default open API URL.

appoverview.title: App Overview

recently.subheader: Below you can find your recently changed apps. By clicking on the app, you can open up the deatils/proceed on the app release process. The sub-menu added to each app card will help you to do changes on active apps. Below the recent changed apps, a list of all by your company provided apps can get found. Please scroll down to get more details.

confirmModal.title: Change app {appName}
confirmModal.description: The app configuration is currently 'work in progress'. Do you want to open the app release process for {appName} and further enhance the app details? Please note you do not need to finish the app release configuration. You can use the save button and proceed later if wanted.

details.title: Submitted App Details
details.description: The app {appName} is already submitted for review by the network administrator to publish the app on the market place. Till the review is finished, you can not do any changes to the app

appoverview.submenuNotAvail: Sub-Menu is not available for inactive apps.

deactivate.description: Deactivation of business applications will deactivate the app offer inside the Cofinity-X marketplace. Any current active subscription will stay active and customers wont be effected by the deactivation. New subscriptions are not possible.
deactivate.checkboxLabel: Hereby I confirm that I have read the business app terms and conditions and that I am deactivating my company business application from the marketplace with immediate effect. I understand that it is not possible to self-reverse the deactivation.
deactivate.checkboxErrorMsg: Please confirm that you have read the deactivation impact above before proceeding

columns.name: Connector Name
columns.sdRegistrationToolTip: The Self-Description is triggered. Process might take up to a couple of minutes.

edcconnector.imagetext: The connector combines the benefits of IDS connectors (secure and standardized communication, data usage control) with the interoperability. To register your connector inside the network and create your connector self-description, please register your connector below.

deletemodal.title: Delete Connector
deletemodal.description: Do you really want to delete the registered connector? Please note that the deletion is not reversable.

company.title: Connect company connector
company.intro: Registration of a company connector which is implemented in your own company network.

managed.title: Register Managed Connector
managed.intro: Register a managed connector of your customer / 3rd party provided. This selection is mainly service provider relevant, which offers managed connectors to data provider/consumer. If you want to register your own connector, please use the selection above.

daps.title: Create DAPS Registration
daps.intro: To retrigger the daps authentication interface, please upload the public authentication key/certificate of your connector.
daps.error: The daps  registration failed. Please reverify the uploaded document

name.label: Name*
name.error: Connector name is mandatory. Length should be between 2 and 20
name.tooltipMsg: Own selected connector name for verification

url.label: Connector URL/Endpoint*
url.error: Enter a valid url - eg: https://cofinity-x.com
url.tooltipMsg: URL of the connector endpoint. Only https:// endpoints are allowed

bpn.label: Connector Owner*
bpn.error: BPN is mandatory. Valid BPN eg: BPNL+12 characters
bpn.tooltipMsg: BPN of the company in which name the connector will be used to generate data offers or consume data

country.label: Location*
country.tooltipMsg: Connector Location Country Code - e.g. DE, US, etc.

doc.label: Public Authentication Key/Certificate*
doc.error: Please use a valid type. E.g. .pem; .cert
doc.tooltipMsg: Upload the certificate that contains your connector's public key information.

technicalUser.titleText: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page (we need content here or we can remove)
technicalUser.headline: Technical user management {{company}}
technicalUser.descriptionText: The technical user is an identity that a company can use to connect to CX backend services without continous disconnection. For example, a run-as technical user is required for connecting to the digital twin registry or the semantic model. Please use the action button to request a new technical user with the roles as per your need. Or manage already existing technical users by using the user management function below.
technicalUser.confirmDeleteUser: Are you sure you want to delete technical user {{ user }}?
technicalUser.noteDeleteUser: Note: The deletion will be permanently. It is not possible the reactive the user again.
technicalUser.confirmDeleteNotificationDescription: The action can not be reversed. Please create a new user in case it's needed

deleteUserConfirm.confirmTitle: Are you sure you want to delete the user account of {userName}?
deleteUserConfirm.description: By deleting the account, the access of this user to Cofinity-X as well as any rights and data access will get revoked.
deleteUserConfirm.note: Note: If you delete the account now, you wont be able to reactivate it later.
deleteUserConfirm.successDescription: The user is successfully deleted and all rights are disabled.
deleteUserConfirm.errorDescription: Your user couldn't get deleted. Please try it later again or contact your administrator.

suspendUserConfirm.confirmTitle: Are you sure you want to suspend the user account of {userName}?
suspendUserConfirm.description: By suspending the account, the access of this user to Cofinity-X as well as any permissions and data accesses will get deactivated temporarily.
suspendUserConfirm.note: Note: Suspended accounts can get reactivated anytime.
suspendUserConfirm.successDescription: The user is successfully suspended and all rights are disabled.
suspendUserConfirm.errorDescription: Your user couldn't get suspended. Please try it later again or contact your administrator.

resetPasswordConfirm.confirmTitle: Are you sure you want to reset the password?
resetPasswordConfirm.note: The user {userName} will receive an email to reset the password.
resetPasswordConfirm.successDescription: The password reset request got send to {userName}.
resetPasswordConfirm.errorDescription: The password reset was unsuccessful. Please try it later again or contact the administrator.

deleteOwnUserConfirm.confirmTitle: Are you sure you want to delete this user account?
deleteOwnUserConfirm.description: By deleting the account, the access of this user to Cofinity-X as well as any rights and data access will get revoked.
deleteOwnUserConfirm.note: Note: If you delete the account now, you wont be able to reactivate it later.
deleteOwnUserConfirm.successDescription: Your user got successfully deleted, you will get disconnected within the following 5 seconds.
deleteOwnUserConfirm.errorDescription: Your user couldn't get deleted. Please try it later again or contact your administrator.

idpmanagement.addIdpSubheadline: Enter an IdP name and choose the idp type to start the configuration
idpmanagement.updateIdpSubheadline:
Configure your idp connection. Retrieve the metadata config file from your local idp and upload the same in the input field below. Additionally the client_id and secret are needed.
Follow the
idpmanagement.updateIdpSubheadline2: to find a number of examples of local idp's such as Azure, Keycloak, etc.
idpmanagement.enableIdpSubheadline: This will open another option for people from your company to sign.
idpmanagement.enableIdpSuccessSubheadline: Go and test the login now
idpmanagement.disableIdpSubheadline: This will remove the option to sign in for people of your company
idpmanagement.description: Here you can manage how the users of your company authenticate with Cofinity-X. On registration we have created an IDP with one user entry for the admin (that's probably you ;). Many companies already have their own IDP where users authenticate using their known company user id and a familiar login mask. In this case you will probably prefer to use your own company IDP and you can create and manage the federation on this page.

idpdetail.title: Identity Provider Details
idpdetail.selectIpsText: Select the type of IdP which should get newly created
idpdetail.addMetaDataText: Add your metadata URL here, to automatically setup all the idp integration relevant metadata. When clicking, load. then metadata file is getting loaded and respective values will show up below.
idpdetail.idp_meta_description: Add your metadata URL here, to automatically setup all the idp integration relevant metadata. When clicking, Load then metadata file is getting loaded and respective values will show up below.

addUser.headline: Add User Account
addUser.subheadline: Add a new user account by adding the user first and last name as well as the email address. Below the input fields select the respective user roles which the user should have. One role is minimum needed to enable the user to access the network.
addUser.multipleUserHeadline: Add multiple users by file upload:
addUser.multipleUserSubheadline: Please use this <1>upload template</1>, to add multiple users via the bulk load.
addUser.technicalUserSubheadline: Create a technical user by adding the relevant information requested below. Please note that the description is used for your own reference only. In case you have a number of technical users it will help you to differenciate between the technical user accounts.
addUser.technicalUserSubheadlineSuccess: Congratulations, the technical user got successfully created. Below you can find all the relevant details needed to apply the technical user for your service connection. Please ensure that you keep this secrets confidential.
addUser.technicalUserSubheadlineError: Something went wrong. The technical user did not got created due to a system error. Please try it later again or contact your administrator.
addUser.helperText: Please enter all required information before proceeding.

addUserRight.headline: Add app permissions to your company user
addUserRight.subheadline: Select one or multiple user roles with the checkboxes below as well as the relevant user/s which should receive the role.

account.headerContent: Manage your personal data and determine what information others can see as well as what apps you can access.
account.manageInfo: Manage your info, privacy, and security to make Cofinity-X work better for you.
account.resetPswrdMaxLimitError: The maximum amount of errors is triggered already. Please try it later again
account.resetPswrdUnsuccessfulError: The password reset was unsuccessful. An issue occurred. Please try It later again
account.resetPswrdPermissionsError: Reset of the password was unsuccessful due to missing permissions.

editRoles.title: Manage User Assigned Portal Role(s)
editRoles.subtitle: Please select additional roles for the user or unselect any role which should get unassigned. Minimum one role need to get selected.
editRoles.errorDescription: Something went wrong. Please try it later again or contact your administrator.

privacy.heading: Privacy Policy
privacy.message: The Privacy Policy states which data the business applications collects, handles and processes. The details below explicitly show which company / user information are getting collected/stored.

howtouse.message: The terms of use, as well as the data models and further information can be viewed by clicking on the documents shared below.

providerInformation.heading: Provider Information

apprelease.descHeading: Publish your company app inside the Cofinity-X marketplace
apprelease.descMessage: Register your app and metdata to get published on the marketplace. Scrolling down, you can find a quick overview of the app release process.

The app card is the first touchpoint with the customer. While entering the data below, have a look at the app card on the left side which is getting autoupdated based on your input.

validateAndPublish.headerDescription: To publish your app on the marketplace, the following Cofinity-X specific agreements need to be signed by you. If there are any changes to the information provided in the previous screens, please go back and make the changes.
validateAndPublish.popupT&CPrivacyPolicyDesc:
Cofinity-X appreciates your visit to our website and your interest in our company. Cofinity-X is a Catena-X operating company, and we take data protection seriously.

This privacy policy describes:

the personal data we collect when you visit our website{' '}
the purposes for which we use this data
the legal basis for the processing of personal data
the recipients of this personal data
the period for which this personal data is to be
stored whether you are obliged to provide personal data
Furthermore, we would like to inform you about:

the existence of your rights in relation to the processing of your personal data
the data processing controller within the meaning of thedata protection laws and, if applicable, our data protection officer(s)
validateAndPublish.popupT&CPoint2Desc: We store the IP address of your device after we remove the last octet of the IP address, i.e., inanonymous form, for web audience measurement, which enables us to improve our website.

serviceMarketplace.headline: Purchase Service Request
serviceMarketplace.description: Dear user, you have requested service {serviceName}. Please find below the Terms and Conditions. Please check the terms and conditions carefully before proceeding. As soon as the terms & conditions are approved, the services provider will start to build up the service.
serviceMarketplace.subscriptionHeading: >> there are already active subscriptions for the service {serviceName}

document.heading: Relevant Documents
document.message: The terms of use, as well as the data models and further information can be viewed by clicking on the documents shared below.

appMarketplace.headline: Order Business Application
appMarketplace.desc1: You have started the subscription request for app {appName}.
appMarketplace.desc2: Please note that the subscription request will trigger a service call on provider side. The app provider will align with you all further steps. This may take up to 5 days.
appMarketplace.desc3: As soon as all queries are finalized, the app provider will be able to activate your app tenant.
appMarketplace.desc4: As soon as the service is up and running, a notification will be send to you, which enables you to assign the relevant user roles and start to use your app.

appSubscription.headline: App Subscription
appSubscription.description: Do you wan't to rather use the autosetup; connect your service to automate marketplace subscription build

register.heading: Autosetup URL
register.message: Enter your autosetup url in the input field below to store the autosetup endpoint. The endpoint will get triggered by CX as soon as a interested company is hitting the 'Subscribe' button in the marketplace.
register.providerErrorMessage: Something went wrong! Please try it later again.

activation.heading: Activate App Subscription
activation.description: Activate the app subscription request of the customer by adding your customer specific app endpoint/url in the input field below. We will use the url to register/activate the app authentication with the CX idp. Additionally you will receive a technical user which can get used to connect the app tenant/connector to the centryl CX components/services (where needed).
activation.successDescription: The technical user has been created with the following data:

declineModal.title: Reject App Release Request {appName}
declineModal.subheading: Are you sure you want to reject the app release request ?
declineModal.declineReason1Label: Create a notification & email message to inform the app provider/manager about the rejection
declineModal.declineReason2Label: An individual message with additional details can get shared by adding the details into the input field below
declineModal.declineReason3Label: The app will get set back to the status “in progress“

providerInformation.heading: Provider Information
providerInformation.message: If you have any question, want to get in contact or visit the provider website, you can find all necessary information below.

checklistOverlay.resolveTitle: Your option to resolve the issue

REGISTRATION_VERIFICATION.stepDescription: Manual validation of the company registration by the operator. Please check the company details as well as uploaded documents and 'accept' / 'decline' the application; depending on the validation results
REGISTRATION_VERIFICATION.additionalText: By declining the application; the registration company will not be able to proceed; a new registration will be needed.

TO_DO.title: Your action is needed to resolve the issue
TO_DO.description: Validate the company registration data and the uploaded documents and confirm or reject the registration. Further process steps are only carried out after confirmation.

IN_PROGRESS.title: No action needed from your side

DONE.title: No action needed from your side

FAILED.title: No action needed from your side
FAILED.description: The registration company got informed about the declined registration form. A new application is needed if you want to proceed.

BUSINESS_PARTNER_NUMBER.stepDescription: Each registration company need to have a business partner number created. In this step the creation of the bpdm is triggered against the bpdm data pool.

TO_DO.title: No action needed from your side
TO_DO.description: The process gets auto triggered with the next automation run.

IN_PROGRESS.title: No action needed from your side

DONE.title: No action needed from your side

FAILED.title: Your action is needed.
FAILED.description: The BPN creation was unsuccessful. You can retrigger the endpoint or close/reject the company registration.

IDENTITY_WALLET.stepDescription: With successful business partner number creation as well as the manual validation of the company registration data; the managed identity wallet is getting generated for the participant.

TO_DO.title: No action needed from your side
TO_DO.description: The process gets auto triggered with the next automation run.

IN_PROGRESS.title: No action needed from your side
IN_PROGRESS.description: The process is currently running/in progress. As soon as the Wallet is created, the status will get automatically updated.

DONE.title: No action needed from your side
DONE.description: The process is successfully completed. The Managed Identity Wallet got created.

FAILED.title: Your action is needed.
FAILED.description: The Identity Wallet creation failed. You can retrigger the endpoint or close/reject the company registration.

CLEARING_HOUSE.stepDescription: Gaia-X Clearinghouse provider is validating the company registration form (company name; address and unique identifier) and after successful validation verified credentials are added to the managed wallet of the customer.

TO_DO.title: No action needed from your side
TO_DO.description: The process gets auto triggered with the next automation run.

IN_PROGRESS.title: No action needed from your side

DONE.title: No action needed from your side

FAILED.title: Your action is needed.
FAILED.description: The clearinghouse check was unsuccessful/failed. Details regarding the unsuccessful validation run may get found above. You can retrigger the endpoint (by resetting the status) or close/reject the company registration.

SELF_DESCRIPTION_LP.stepDescription: Legal person / company Self Description is created by the SD Factory and signed and send back by the clearinghouse. The process might take a while since its an asyncron interface.

TO_DO.title: No action needed from your side
TO_DO.description: The process gets auto triggered with the next automation run.

IN_PROGRESS.title: No action needed from your side

DONE.title: No action needed from your side

FAILED.title: Your action is needed.
FAILED.description: The self-description creation was unsuccessful. Details regarding the unsuccessful process can get found below. Additionally you can retrigger the endpoint (by resetting the status) or close/reject the company registration.

errors.title: Oops, Something went wrong.
errors.description: The server encountered an internal error or misconfiguration and was unable to complete your request.
